title: Leveraging the bio-enabled muconic acid platform via phospha-Michael-addition: intrinsically flame-retardant nylon-66/DOPO copolymers
content:
RSC Sustain., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4SU00184B, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Prerana Carter, Peter M. Meyer, Ting-Han Lee, Dhananjay Dileep, Nickolas L. Chalgren, Sohaima Noreen, Michael J. Forrester, Brent H. Shanks, Jean-Philippe Tessonnier, Eric W. Cochran
We report the tethering of flame-retardant additives like 9,10-dihydro-9-oxa-10-phosphaphenanthrene-10-oxide (DOPO) to the backbone of a polyamide through trans-3-hexenedioic acid, a bioadvantaged derivative of muconic acid.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
